Highways England is looking to set up a contract for provision of a Programme Manager. We would be looking for The Consultant to provide a part time Programme Manager resource from 15th June 2020 to 31st March 2021 to programme manage the delivery of a transformation project called Spatial Planning Review. The Spatial Planning Review is a complex transformation for Operations which will involve the development and establishment of new ways of working across all of Operations Spatial Planning Teams, improving the service provided to customers and developing the professionalism across the directorate.

Award Description:
The award of the Historical Railways Estate (HRE) - Works Framework 2020. The key purpose of this tender exercise is to deliver the Works element of the Historical Railways Estate (HRE) Provision. The works framework will provide the minor works intervention and, from time to time, reactive maintenance for 3190 assets throughout mainland Great Britain. 

Lot 1 - National - Major Works 
Typically, these orders equate to £200k or above. All works on this lot are awarded following secondary competition. This lot will hold three suppliers.

Lot 2 - North - Minor Works & Emergency response 
Typically, these orders equate to less than £200k. All works will be awarded via Direct Allocation. This lot will hold three suppliers.

Lot 3 - South - Minor Works & Emergency response 
Typically, these orders equate to less than £200k. All works will be awarded via Direct Allocation on this. This lot will hold three suppliers.

The LTC project is currently supported by a long running contract referred to as the Technical Partner. This wide-ranging contract was originally set up for the development phase of the project. The activity under the Technical Partner contract is now being refocused on activities to support the main works procurement and DCO process. Highways England (HE) is aiming to procure a limited volume of specialist technical services to support HE in the transition of the LTC project from the Development phase into the Delivery Phase, where a Delivery partner as well as the Technical Partner will support HE. 
The Delivery Partner contract is currently in the procurement phase. The work required under this work package will not be carried out by the Technical partner to avoid conflicts. This work package is for limited time period until the Delivery Partner for LTC is mobilised sufficiently to take over activities (expected late Q3/Q4 2020/21). In addition to supporting the transition some other services are included to support HE staff where the use of Technical Partner staff would create a conflict.

Award Title: 1-1065 Regulatory Monitoring and Compliance Technical Partne
Award Description: Highways England is looking to set up a contract for a regulatory monitoring and compliance technical partner with experience of working and advising regulated companies. The contract will support the Monitoring and Road Investment Strategy (RIS) Compliance Division of the Strategy and Planning Directorate. The division is responsible for managing the company's compliance with our obligations as set out in the RIS, our License and Framework. It also manages the company's critical stakeholder relationships with the Department for Transport, Transport Focus and the Office of Rail and Road (ORR).
